alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Talbot; Taylor; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 6:13AM EDT until April 09 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Talbot, Upson, Taylor and Crawford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Access Road to boat ramp and parking lot to boat ramp flood. In addition... flooding of most of the land at the bend of the river upstream develops. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 24.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 18 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
